chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien B Connor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Damien B Connor in court. Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Damien B Connor. Court called 21 CF 218 (Br 2 case), 21 CF 423 (Br 3 case) & 22 CF 10 (Br 1 case). Court reviewed right to preliminary hearing, defendant waived. Court found probable cause, bound over in all 3 cases. Not guilty pleas entered on all charges/cases. Matter to be set for trial. Pre-trial previously scheduled for 05/10/22 at 1:30 p.m. 9:53 AM

3:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Damien B Connor did not appear. Court called 22 CF 110, addressed 21 CF 423. Matters were scheduled for prelims. Court was notified today defendant ill; addressed minutes reflected in 22 CF 110 from the 02/28/22 Initial Appearance, defendant did not waive time limits, entered in error; Court finds good cause to waive time limits. The 02/28/22 hearing minutes in 21 CF 423 correct. Matters to be reset. 3:55 PM
all previous conditions remain, filed by the Columbia County Sheriff's Office

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Damien B Connor appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail. Attorney Gibson Hatch appeared by video for the defendant. Court called 22 CF 110 & 21 CF 423 (Br 3 case/warrant status). 22 CF 110 -  Waived reading. Right to atty. $250.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Waived time limits. (NOTE 03/09/22 - time limit minutes in error, time limits were not waived on 02/28/22) 21 CF 423 - Court quashed warrant, ordered an additional $250.00 cash bond, reinstated prior conditions. Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm for both cases. 1:27 PM
